chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 16-year-old female with autoimmune hepatitis (AIH) and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), treated with vedolizumab and other drugs. Lab results from Table 1 show peak values: ALT 873 Units/L at readmission, AST 706 Units/L at readmission, ALP 219 Units/L at readmission, GGT 48 Units/L at presentation and readmission, Bilirubin (total) 3.9 mg/dL and direct 2.6 mg/dL at readmission, INR 1.4 at readmission, Albumin lowest 3.2 g/dL at presentation. Clinical outcome: The patient improved after treatment with steroids and was discharged, with follow-up showing improved lab values at 8 months, indicating recovery.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Total bilirubin 3.9 mg/dL, Direct bilirubin 2.6 mg/dL
